part.narration: Through Yuki's apartment echo the sounds of sonic boom, sonic boom, sonic boom. Nozomi pushes buttons. Yuki laughs. From the edge of the bed Nozomi raises.
part.line: I'm gonna go get something out of the other house, okay?
part.narration: Dolly out of the door.Yuki stares out the door as Nozomi leaves. Cut back to keep only the room in view.
The single lightbulb on the lamp near the television flickers. Yuki raises her brow.Yuki urges Player to get a look at the bulb.
Yuki observes the bulb. It flickers and the television turns off.Here, the Player can use Main Action to attempt to turn the device back on.Attempts to revive it fail.

Yuki views electric to electric to electric, and with every view they die and fail to be revived.The various electric items in the room are brought to the Player's attention, and every time the Player goes to observe one, another dies in the distance.

All that remains is the single lightbulb on the single lamp near the single television with its last flicker. Yuki nears it. It dies. Not a single whirr or buzz lives in this room. Only Yuki. Only Yuki. Only Yuki, who drops to knees. Only Yuki, who curls fetal. Only Yuki, who tears by eyes and stares out wide and into the cracks of walls sings:
part.line: You don't have to win to be happy~
But being happy is just how you win~
part.narration: Nozomi enters the room and the thing she got drops. She gasps and runs to her wife's side. Yuki rocks back and forth and sings:
part.line: So why do we all fight for freedom~
When we all had freedom within~
Together, your hands, and calm, your heart~
I know we aren't all from the same world~
But we all live in the same time~
part.narration: Yuki focuses on her voice, her downcast eyes shielded by her side-swept fringe. Zoom in on Yuki's face. Sudden shift.
